questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
options: HyperText Markup Language
HyperText Machine Language
HyperText Making Language
Hyper Transfer Markup Language
questions.answer: HyperText Markup Language

questions.question: Which of the following is a CSS framework?
options: React
Angular
Vue
Bootstrap
questions.answer: Bootstrap

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in JavaScript?
options: To refer to the global object
To refer to the current object
To refer to the parent object
To refer to the child object
questions.answer: To refer to the current object

questions.question: What is the difference between null and undefined in JavaScript?
options: null is an object, undefined is a primitive
null is a primitive, undefined is an object
null represents a deliberate absence of value, undefined represents an uninitialized variable
null represents an uninitialized variable, undefined represents a deliberate absence of value
questions.answer: null represents a deliberate absence of value, undefined represents an uninitialized variable

questions.question: What is the purpose of the box model in CSS?
options: To calculate the size of an element
To calculate the position of an element
To calculate the layout of an element
To calculate the style of an element
questions.answer: To calculate the size of an element

questions.question: What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A function that has access to its own scope
A function that has access to its parent scope
A function that has access to the global scope
A function that returns another function
questions.answer: A function that has access to its own scope

questions.question: What is the difference between == and === in JavaScript?
options: == checks for value equality, === checks for reference equality
== checks for reference equality, === checks for value equality
== checks for loose equality, === checks for strict equality
== checks for strict equality, === checks for loose equality
questions.answer: == checks for loose equality, === checks for strict equality

questions.question: What is the purpose of the async/await syntax in JavaScript?
options: To handle synchronous code
To handle asynchronous code
To handle promises
To handle callbacks
questions.answer: To handle asynchronous code

questions.question: What is the difference between a library and a framework?
options: A library is a collection of functions, a framework is a collection of libraries
A library is a collection of libraries, a framework is a collection of functions
A library provides a set of functionalities, a framework provides a structure
A library provides a structure, a framework provides a set of functionalities
questions.answer: A library provides a set of functionalities, a framework provides a structure

questions.question: What is the purpose of the CSS selector :nth-child()?
options: To select the first child element
To select the last child element
To select a specific child element
To select all child elements
questions.answer: To select a specific child element

questions.question: What is the difference between a GET request and a POST request?
options: A GET request is used to retrieve data, a POST request is used to send data
A GET request is used to send data, a POST request is used to retrieve data
A GET request is used to update data, a POST request is used to delete data
A GET request is used to delete data, a POST request is used to update data
questions.answer: A GET request is used to retrieve data, a POST request is used to send data

questions.question: What is the purpose of the JavaScript event loop?
options: To handle synchronous code
To handle asynchronous code
To handle promises
To handle callbacks
questions.answer: To handle asynchronous code

questions.question: What is the difference between a promise and an observable?
options: A promise handles a single value, an observable handles multiple values
A promise handles multiple values, an observable handles a single value
A promise is used for synchronous code, an observable is used for asynchronous code
A promise is used for asynchronous code, an observable is used for synchronous code
questions.answer: A promise handles a single value, an observable handles multiple values

questions.question: What is the purpose of the CSS property 'flexbox'?
options: To layout elements in a grid
To layout elements in a row or column
To layout elements in a table
To layout elements in a block
questions.answer: To layout elements in a row or column

questions.question: What is the difference between a class and an interface in JavaScript?
options: A class is used to define a blueprint, an interface is used to define a contract
A class is used to define a contract, an interface is used to define a blueprint
A class is used to define a function, an interface is used to define a variable
A class is used to define a variable, an interface is used to define a function
questions.answer: A class is used to define a blueprint, an interface is used to define a contract

questions.question: What is the purpose of the JavaScript method 'map()'?
options: To iterate over an array and return a new array
To iterate over an object and return a new object
To iterate over a string and return a new string
To iterate over a number and return a new number
questions.answer: To iterate over an array and return a new array

questions.question: What is the difference between a shallow copy and a deep copy?
options: A shallow copy copies the reference, a deep copy copies the value
A shallow copy copies the value, a deep copy copies the reference
A shallow copy is used for objects, a deep copy is used for arrays
A shallow copy is used for arrays, a deep copy is used for objects
questions.answer: A shallow copy copies the reference, a deep copy copies the value

questions.question: What is the purpose of the CSS property 'position'?
options: To position an element relative to its parent
To position an element relative to the viewport
To position an element relative to the document
To position an element relative to itself
questions.answer: To position an element relative to its parent

questions.question: What is the difference between a var and a let in JavaScript?
options: var is function scoped, let is block scoped
var is block scoped, let is function scoped
var is used for constants, let is used for variables
var is used for variables, let is used for constants
questions.answer: var is function scoped, let is block scoped

questions.question: What is the purpose of the JavaScript method 'reduce()'?
options: To iterate over an array and return a single value
To iterate over an object and return a single value
To iterate over a string and return a single value
To iterate over a number and return a single value
questions.answer: To iterate over an array and return a single value
